sentence.Network_en: Civilization is on the brink of apocalypse.
sentence.Network_cn: 文明已濒临毁灭的边缘。

sentence.Network_en: We live in the shadow of the apocalypse, of a catastrophe that will mean the end of the world itself.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们生活在意味着世界末日将要到来的灾难的阴影当中。

sentence.Network_en: It's Ride of the Valkyries from Apocalypse Now.
sentence.Network_cn: 那是《现代启示录》里的《狂热的瓦格纳》.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English , via Old French and ecclesiastical Latin from Greek apokalupsis, from apokaluptein 'uncover, reveal', from apo- 'un-' + kaluptein 'to cover'

entry.def: The apocalypse is the total destruction and end of the world.

example.ex: We live in the shadow of the apocalypse, of a catastrophe that will mean the end of the world itself.
example.tran: 我们生活在意味着世界末日将要到来的灾难的阴影当中。

means.word_mean: 1. a cosmic cataclysm in which God destroys the ruling powers of evil

auth_sentence.content: For the Welsh the sense of apocalypse was overwhelming.
